---
title: Welcome
---




> Report run date: Wednesday, April 02, 2025

## Integrated Ecosystem Assesments

[description]

![Sorting and weighing fish on deck on the 2022 Bering Sea groundfish survey aboard the F/V Alaska Knight. Credit: Emily Markowitz/NOAA Fisheries.](https://www.fisheries.noaa.gov/s3/2023-04/750x500-bottom-trawl-survey-afsc.jpg)

## Documentation Objective

As part of our commitment to open science, reproducibility, and transparency, we provide this  metadata guide to compliment our public-domain data. 

> Please consider this resource to be a **Living Document**. The code in this repository is regularly being updated and improved. Please refer to [releases](https://github.com/IEA-Data/IEA_Data_Guidance_Doc//releases) for finalized products and project milestones.

> Do not hesitate to reach out (to us at either [email] or [GitHub issues](https://github.com/IEA-Data/IEA_Data_Guidance_Doc//issues), especially if you find discrepancies in the data or want to suggest improvements to infrastructure. Thank you in advance for your collaboration and partnership with us as we develop our future data universe.

## User Resources

-   [IEA Ecosystem Status Reports](https://www.integratedecosystemassessment.noaa.gov/ecosystem-status-reports)

## Cite this data

Use the below [bibtext citations](https://github.com/IEA-Data/IEA_Data_Guidance_Doc//blob/main/CITATION.bib), as cited in our group's [citation repository](https://github.com/IEA-Data/citations/blob/main/cite/bibliography.bib) for citing the data created and maintained in this repo. Add "note = {Accessed: mm/dd/yyyy}" to append the day this data was accessed. Included here are AFSC RACE Groundfish and Shellfish Assessment Program's: 


::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

@misc{IEA-Data,
  author = {{National Integrated Ecosystem Assessment Program}},
  title = {National Integrated Ecosystem Assessment Program},
  howpublished = {https://www.integratedecosystemassessment.noaa.gov/ecosystem-status-reports},
  publisher = {{U.S. Dep. Commer.}},
  copyright = {Public Domain} 
}
```


:::
:::


## Access Constraints

There are no legal restrictions on access to the data. They reside in public domain and can be freely distributed.

**User Constraints:** Users must read and fully comprehend the metadata and [code of conduct](https://IEA-Data.io/IEA_Data_Guidance_Doc/content/code-of-conduct.html) prior to use. Data should not be used beyond the limits of the source scale. Acknowledgement of the Program, as the source from which these data were obtained, in any publications and/or other representations of these data, is suggested.

## Suggestions and comments

If the data or metadata can be improved, please create a pull request or [submit an issue to the code's repository](https://github.com/IEA-Data/IEA_Data_Guidance_Doc//issues).
